Refactor project into monorepo structure with web and mobile apps

This commit transforms the single TanStack Start web app into a 
comprehensive npm workspaces monorepo supporting both web and mobile 
platforms with shared code.

## Project Structure Changes
- Created monorepo with npm workspaces
- Moved web app to `apps/web/`
- Added React Native \(Expo\) app in `apps/mobile/`
- Organized shared packages in `packages/`

## Shared Packages
- `@metasquares/shared`: Common game types and logic
  - Player enum \(Red, Blue, None\)
  - Point, Square, and MetaSquare types
  - Shared between web and mobile apps
- `@metasquares/convex`: Shared Convex backend
  - Moved from root to packages for cross-platform use
  - Optional configuration with graceful fallback

## Web App Updates
- Updated all imports to use shared packages
- Added TypeScript path mappings for monorepo
- Made Convex optional to allow development without backend
- Created `.env.example` for configuration documentation
- Moved environment files to `apps/web/.env.local`

## Mobile App
- Initialized React Native app with Expo and TypeScript
- Configured to use shared types and Convex backend
- Ready for game component porting from web

## Developer Experience
- Added VS Code launch configurations for both apps
- Updated `.gitignore` for monorepo structure
- Created comprehensive documentation:
  - Updated README.md with monorepo overview
  - Created CLAUDE.MD with detailed technical guide
  - Added Convex setup documentation

## Configuration
- Root `package.json` with workspace scripts
- Per-app package.json for dependencies
- Shared TypeScript configurations

This refactor enables cross-platform development while maintaining 
code reusability and consistent game logic across web and mobile.
